summary: The Department of Energy has been building facilities to treat highly radioactive waste at its Hanford site in Washington state. One facility will cost $10 billion to finish and will treat 3 million gallons. Experts said there are alternative methods for treating this waste. They say that these methods could help DOE remove waste from the state earlier, and save taxpayer money. DOE hasn't fully...
title: Hanford Cleanup: Alternatives for Treating and Disposing of High-Level Waste Could Save Billions of Dollars and Reduce Certain Risks
